messages.content:
can you keep this exactly as is except remove a few unneeded words/reorganize a tiny bit to make a a few lines shorter?
Cover Letter
Respected Mr. Mahmoud Aziz Jabbar, Senior Chief Engineer,
General Manager, Baghdad Sewerage Department – Baghdad Municipality

Subject: Project for Design, Execution, and Operation of a Vertical Wastewater Treatment Unit near Medical City
Referring to your letter number 1234/2/2 dated 12/2/2024,
Firstly, we thank you for the trust you have placed in the three coalition companies for the above-mentioned project.
Enclosed, please find the details necessary for the inclusion of our project as per the following details and sequence:
We attach a detailed report covering all requirements for inclusion except for the "land ownership deed" for the designated land, which can be obtained from Engineer Haider Al-Janabi, the Deputy to the General Manager, who is in charge of the land matter, as per our understanding. The rest of the sections are as follows:
1- Introduction.
2- Detailed report on environmental impact and economic feasibility with a comparative table against traditional treatment, pages: 4 to 14.
3- Technical and engineering report on vertical treatment technology, patents, and similar works. Pages: 14 to 45.
4- Preliminary design diagrams.
5- Detailed quantity schedule with used equipment.
6- Conclusions and the importance of the project.
We also confirm the following:
- Please be advised that the diagrams submitted with this letter are preliminary, and the final execution diagrams will depend on several variables and tests, including the examination of the sewage model at the Medical City site discharging into the river, and tests for a miniature model of the vertical treatment plant, as well as site soil tests.
- Be informed that the total project cost will not change and is fixed.
- The possibility of beginning to filter sewage waters discharging into the Tigris near Medical City within the first 6 months of work commencement, with a high filtration rate, subject to the actual additional cost agreed upon.
- An agreement has been reached with specialists and experts at the University of Technology, Baghdad, to supervise the project phases from inspection, design, and execution. This is in addition to appointing an international consulting firm chosen by the Baghdad Sewerage Department at our expense for final approval of all work stages.
- We commit to training an Iraqi team for operating and maintaining the plant within the total project price.
- We can also attach the initial and revised offer submitted to your esteemed administration on [date] and [date], should more technical information be required.
- We agree to the dollar exchange rate according to the Central Bank of Iraq's pricing stated in your letter, which is 1320 Iraqi Dinar, subject to payment as per Section Eight (Quantity and Price Tables) attached with the letter, which includes two amounts:
    a. An amount of $87,908,497 (Eighty-seven million nine hundred eight thousand four hundred ninety-seven US dollars) for the importation of machinery, tools, chemicals, and services from specialized global companies.
    b. An amount of 91,932,214,895 Iraqi Dinar (Ninety-one billion nine hundred thirty-two million two hundred fourteen thousand eight hundred ninety-five Dinar) for local market materials, machinery, and labor.

Cover Letter

Mr. Mahmoud Aziz Jabbar, Senior Chief Engineer, 
General Manager, 
Baghdad Sewerage Department – Baghdad Municipality

Subject: Vertical Wastewater Treatment Unit Project near Medical City
Ref: Your letter no. 1234/2/2 dated 12/2/2024

Respected Mr. Jabbar,

We appreciate the confidence you have shown in the coalition companies for the stated project. Enclosed are the necessary project details:

1. Introduction.
2. Report on environmental impact, economic feasibility, and comparison with traditional treatment (pages: 4 to 14).
3. Technical/engineering report on vertical treatment technology, patents, and similar works (pages: 14 to 45).
4. Preliminary design diagrams.
5. Quantity schedule and equipment list.
6. Conclusions and project significance.

We also confirm:
- Submitted diagrams are preliminary; final designs will depend on various tests, including sewage examination at Medical City and soil testing.
- The total project cost is fixed.
- Possibility of beginning filtration near Medical City within 6 months, subject to additional costs.
- Collaboration with the University of Technology, Baghdad for project supervision and an international firm for final approval.
- Commitment to training an Iraqi team for plant operation within the project budget.
- Availability of initial and revised offers for technical details.
- Adherence to the Central Bank of Iraq's exchange rate (1320 Dinar) as per your letter.
- Financial breakdown:
    a. $87,908,497 for importation (machinery, tools, chemicals, services).
    b. 91,932,214,895 Dinar for local materials, machinery, and labor.

Note: The "land ownership deed" is obtainable from Engineer Haider Al-Janabi, Deputy General Manager.

We look forward to a successful partnership.

Sincerely,

[Your Name]
[Your Position]
[Your Contact Information]
That's too different, keep it much closer to the original

Cover Letter

Respected Mr. Mahmoud Aziz Jabbar, 
Senior Chief Engineer, General Manager, 
Baghdad Sewerage Department – Baghdad Municipality

Subject: Project for Design, Execution, and Operation of a Vertical Wastewater Treatment Unit near Medical City
Ref: Your letter number 1234/2/2 dated 12/2/2024

We are grateful for your trust in our coalition companies for this project. Enclosed are the necessary details for our project's inclusion, arranged as follows:

1. Introduction.
2. Environmental impact and economic feasibility report, with comparative analysis, pages: 4 to 14.
3. Technical and engineering report on vertical treatment technology, including patents and similar works, pages: 14 to 45.
4. Preliminary design diagrams.
5. Detailed quantity schedule and equipment used.
6. Conclusions and project importance.

Further confirmations:
- The enclosed diagrams are preliminary. Final execution will depend on various tests, including sewage and soil analysis at Medical City.
- The total project cost remains fixed.
- Possibility of starting sewage filtration near Medical City within 6 months, subject to the agreed actual additional cost.
- Collaboration with University of Technology, Baghdad, and an international consulting firm, chosen by your department, for supervising all project phases.
- Commitment to training an Iraqi team for plant operation, included in the total project price.
- Option to provide initial and revised offers for additional technical information.
- Adherence to the dollar exchange rate of 1320 Iraqi Dinar, as per your letter, with payment according to Section Eight (Quantity and Price Tables).

Regarding the "land ownership deed" for the designated land, it can be acquired from Engineer Haider Al-Janabi, Deputy to the General Manager, who oversees this matter.

Budget breakdown:
- $87,908,497 for importing machinery, tools, chemicals, and services.
- 91,932,214,895 Iraqi Dinar for local materials, machinery, and labor.

We anticipate a fruitful collaboration.

[Your Name]
[Your Position]
